params.markdown:
## Amazon Bedrock Guardrails

This dashboard provides insights into the following:
- Guardrail invocations, invocation latency
- Text units utilized by different guardrail policies
- Policy types involved in guardrail interventions
### Guardrail policy types of intervened invocations

panelsJSON.title: Number of invocations where the guardrails intervened - by Policy Type (Input)

attributes.description: The sum of guardrail policy invocations grouped by guardrail policy name and policy version
The sum of guardrail policy invocations grouped by guardrail policy name and policy version

panelsJSON.title: Number of invocations where the guardrails intervened - by Policy Type (Output)

attributes.description: The sum of guardrail policy invocations grouped by guardrail policy name and policy version

panelsJSON.title: Count of Text Units - by Policy Type (Input)
Count of Text Units - by Policy Type (Output)
Invocations - With and Without guardrail interventions

embeddableConfig.description: The sum of guardrail policy invocations grouped by guardrail policy name and policy version

If guardrail intervened where the content is only masked, the exact content is returned with masking applied.

If guardrail intervened and blocked the request content, the outputs field will be a single text, which is the canned message based on guardrail configuration.

panelsJSON.title: Number of invocations where guardrails intervened

embeddableConfig.description: Each guardrail policy is billed per 1,000 text units, where each text unit can contain up to 1,000 characters.
Adding guardrails could result in increased latency. The extra latency will depend on the input and response lengths and the guardrails’ implementation and configuration.

params.markdown: #### Guardrail Invocations By Content Source (Input & Output)
